chapter.title: Kubernetes
chapter.para: Cockpit has a dashboard that interacts with a Kubernetes cluster or an Openshift v3 cluster. This functionality is in the Cockpit kubernetes package.
The dashboard can either be deployed on kubernetes as a container in a pod or used via a normal authenticated Cockpit session. Cockpit communicates with Kubernetes via its REST API.

section.title: Used as a Kubernetes Pod
section.para: The Kubernetes dashboard can be deployed as a pod on Kubernetes requiring users to log in using the standard standard authentication configured for access to its API.

The pod can be used on kubernetes that is configured with basic authentication. By default the pod tries to access the kubernetes API securely and expects that the kubernetes API server has been deployed with a CA, certificate files and service account key. In order to change this behavior, edit the kubernetes-cockpit.json and change the KUBE_INSECURE environment variable to true.

section.title: Used as an Openshift Pod
section.para: The Kubernetes dashboard can be deployed as a pod on Openshift, and use Openshift OAuth authentication. Some configuration issues remain. For now take a look at the containers/kubernetes/README.md file in the Cockpit repository.

section.title: Used in a standard Cockpit session
section.para: When the Kubernetes dashboard is used in a standard Cockpit login session, usually some form of authentication is necessary to access the Kubernetes REST API. Like the kubectl and oc commands, Cockpit uses the authentication and server information in the ~/.kube/config file for the logged in user.
If a user is able to use kubectl successfully when at their shell terminal, then that same user will able to use Kubernetes dashboard when logged into Cockpit:
section.programlisting: $ kubectl get pods NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE docker-registry-1-l4pyh 1/1 Running 10 23d ...
section.para: When running Openshift one can use the oc login command to configure the ~/.kube/config file correctly. This in turn allows Cockpit to use that login information.
